metadata.description:
This data is simulated by regional model WRF (version 4.2.1).
The model is driven by initial and six-hour updates of the lateral boundary conditions data, including the meteorological fields from NASA MERRA2 reanalysis data and the soil data from NASA GLDAS2. The resolution of the model is 20 km. The number of vertical layers is 33, and the number of soil layers is 4 (0-10cm, 10-40cm, 40-100cm, 100-200cm). The simulation covers the area around Tibetan Plateau (about 13-52 ° N, 68-142 ° E) from 1991 to 2015, including April to August every year. Hourly and 6-hourly output data from the model are provided.
The purpose of this data is to evaluate the simulation ability of WRF in plateau area and to explore the influence of initial land surface and snow cover on the capability of regional model. It provides data for evaluation and comparison between regional models.

本数据由区域模式WRF（版本4.2.1）模拟得到。
模拟驱动的初始场和边界场中，气象要素来自NASA MERRA2 数据，土壤要素来自NASA GLDAS2数据。模式分辨率为20公里，垂直层数为33层，土壤层数为4层(0-10cm，10-40cm，40-100cm，100-200cm)。模拟区域大约包括13-52°N，68-142°E，模拟时间为1991-2015年，每年4-8月。提供模拟输出结果包括逐小时和逐六小时数据。
本数据旨在评估区域模式WRF在高原地区的模拟能力，探索初始陆面和积雪等对区域模式模拟和预测效果的影响，为区域模式评估和模式间对比提供数据。

background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Therefore, we also inspect the anomalous stream function from the simulated wind. The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, there are phase differences between the simulated wave train and the observations. However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. The main difference is that the simulated atmospheric response in model ensemble evolve faster than the observation. The associated diversities in the model response in the Southern Hemispheric circulations could be one of the main reasons that the simulated response exhibit great inconsistency with the observation, though the model ensembles show strong Southern Hemispheric responses especially in the mid-high latitudes.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）干旱和洪水的预测是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，如与马登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了预测的来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏高原下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是青藏高原上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应对应于青藏高原上的冷异常，导致大气下沉并在上层产生负位势高度异常。此外，图5a中显示了从青藏高原向北太平洋下游明显的波状模式的位势高度差。青藏高原上的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现了一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对青藏高原冷表面的位势高度响应（图5a, b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，能够大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（teleconnections），例如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系，已经得到了广泛的研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，可以探讨热带高原（TP）表面异常的详细特征以及大气环流对其的全球响应。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流波列（TRC波列）在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的模拟响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的具体机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带地区陆地表面温度/土壤湿度（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC波列）的动态特征相结合，并强调其在提高季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，从热带地区到南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异。
然而，模拟波列与观测之间存在相位差异。然而，从北大西洋到乌拉尔山脉的区域，观测到的地势高度异常与多模型平均值呈现相反的符号，这表明在这些区域，地表冷却可能不是观测到的环流异常的主要原因。主要的区别在于，模型集合中模拟的气候响应演变速度快于观测。南半球环流中模型响应的相关多样性可能是模拟响应与观测之间存在巨大不一致的主要原因之一，尽管模型集合在南半球中高纬度地区表现出强烈的响应。

与观测相比，LS4P-I的气候模型（ESMs）在2003年5月未能很好地捕捉到T2m的冷异常。16个LS4P-I气候模型的集合均值在青藏高原（TP）上表现出1.02°C的暖偏差，这一偏差强于TP T2m观测的年际变化标准差（约0.7°C）。模型集合均值的偏差空间分布如图1b所示，显示出2003年5月青藏高原东部T2m的明显暖偏差。LS4P-I模拟进一步表明，青藏高原的表面热状态不仅对北半球具有全球影响，还影响南半球的外热带大气环流，尽管由于模型间的变异性，这一影响存在较大不确定性。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中与2003年5月的观测结果（图5b）一起展示，以进一步探讨大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的观测气温（T2m）异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过东北亚和白令海峡调节一个持久的准纬向青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC波列），该波列从青藏高原延伸到北美西部，同时影响春季的西风急流。这种由青藏高原热异常调节的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏高原的陆地表面温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节间到季节的变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波动列车在影响TP表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波动列车如何影响这些不同区域的降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在强西风急流横跨亚太地区的情况下，TP表面降温会产生一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（时间尺度超过一个月）TRC波动列车，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

Xue et al. (2022) 讨论了响应于青藏 Plateau (TP) 地表温度/土壤湿度效应的六月降水模拟集合均值的关键特征。然而，LS4P-I 实验表明，TP 表面异常可以导致大气环流的持续和全球尺度异常，并对季节到季节的时间尺度上的夏季气温 (T2m) 和降水产生近全球影响。此外，LS4P-I 实验确认并强调了热带环流 (TRC) 波列在 TP 表面异常全球影响中的重要甚至关键作用。对 16 个先进的地球系统模型 (ESMs) 的分析首次表明，春季 TP 表面异常可以调节持久的准气柱 TRC 波列。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏高原（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候方面发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，尤其是在S2S预测中，其应用在很大程度上被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是检验2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这种缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在西澳大利亚和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是涉及其他一些过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录被用来检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点和中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。观察结果和多个地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致性表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区地面温度的模拟，从而使ESM能够更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能通过升高的加热成为S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.
backgroundCn: 在亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上成功预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测面临的主要挑战之一，预测失败可能导致对社会和经济产生重大不利影响。提高S2S时间尺度的预测技能需要进一步理解该时间尺度气候变率的机制以及识别可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）为S2S时间尺度提供了一种新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表冷却的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。
challengesCn: 未能捕捉到TRC波动的参与模型在参考观测和成功模型时，严重低估了气候异常。然而，从青藏 Plateau（TP）到南半球的模拟传播路径在不同模型之间存在较大差异。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的观测气温（T2m）异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过持久的准纬向青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球(TRC)波列，从青藏 Plateau 通过东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，同时影响整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的第一源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a challenge encountered when using Earth System Models to simulate atmospheric responses to land surface temperature anomalies?
Example.QuestionCn: 使用地球系统模型模拟大气对陆地表面温度异常反应时遇到的一个挑战的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge is that current Earth System Models often fail to fully preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data, which provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. This results in large inter-model differences, particularly in the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是，当前的地球系统模型往往无法充分保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，导致初始的大气/陆地条件不平衡。这导致了模型之间的巨大差异，特别是在从青藏高原向南半球传播路径方面。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the method of initializing land surface temperature and snowpack in climate models for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中，初始化地表温度和雪盖的方法是为了改善亚季节到季节的预测。
Definition.AnswerEn: In climate models, the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack involves adjusting the initial conditions of land surface and subsurface temperatures based on observed anomalies and model biases. This approach aims to enhance the model's ability to predict precipitation anomalies by accurately representing the thermal state of land surfaces, especially in high-mountain areas like the Tibetan Plateau.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气候模型中，陆地表面温度和雪盖的初始化涉及根据观测异常和模型偏差调整陆地表面和地下温度的初始条件。这种方法旨在通过准确表示陆地表面的热状态，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区，提高模型预测降水异常的能力。

Definition.QuestionEn: What datasets are typically used to study the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns in climate research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候研究中，通常使用哪些数据集来研究地表温度异常对全球降水模式的影响？
Definition.AnswerEn: Datasets used in such studies include the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for temperature anomalies, the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for atmospheric circulation data, and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation analysis.
Definition.AnswerCn: 用于此类研究的数据集包括国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的温度异常数据、第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）大气重分析（ERA5）的气候循环数据，以及气候研究单位（CRU）用于全球降水分析的数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods in subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) prediction studies using LST/SUBT initialization compare to traditional atmospheric reanalysis techniques?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在使用地表温度（LST）/土壤温度（SUBT）初始化的亚季节到季节（S2S）预测研究中，数据收集方法与传统的大气再分析技术相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Studies in subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction often employ innovative LST/SUBT initialization methods to enhance prediction skill, particularly in high-mountain regions. In contrast, traditional atmospheric reanalysis techniques, such as those used in ERA5, rely on comprehensive historical data assimilation. The former focuses on improving model initialization to address biases, while the latter emphasizes historical data accuracy and consistency.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 亚季节到季节预测的研究通常采用创新的陆地表面温度/土壤湿度初始化方法，以提高预测技能，特别是在高山地区。相比之下，传统的大气再分析技术，如ERA5，依赖于全面的历史数据同化。前者侧重于改善模型初始化以解决偏差，而后者则强调历史数据的准确性和一致性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced between using land surface temperature data from high-mountain regions and sea surface temperature data in global climate models?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 高山地区的地表温度数据与海洋表面温度数据在全球气候模型中面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Land surface temperature data from high-mountain regions present challenges related to model parameterization and the need for robust land initialization, often limited by observational data. Sea surface temperature data, while more widely studied, are primarily challenged by their partial role in explaining climate predictability. High-mountain LST/SUBT can offer new sources of predictability, but their integration into models is complex due to initialization and model memory issues.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度数据在模型参数化和稳健的土地初始化方面存在挑战，通常受到观测数据的限制。海表温度数据虽然研究较多，但主要面临部分解释气候可预测性的挑战。高山地区的地表温度/地下温度可以提供新的可预测性来源，但由于初始化和模型记忆问题，它们的整合到模型中是复杂的。

Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets for observing T2m anomalies in the Tibetan Plateau, such as those from NOAA's CAMS, focus on specific regional temperature variations with high spatial resolution. The former is essential for detailed regional climate studies, while the latter is crucial for understanding global precipitation patterns.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 用于观察青藏高原T2m异常的数据集，如NOAA的CAMS，专注于特定区域的温度变化，具有较高的空间分辨率。相比之下，全球降水数据通常来自气候研究单位（CRU），提供更广泛的覆盖范围，但可能无法精确捕捉局部现象。前者对于详细的区域气候研究至关重要，而后者对于理解全球降水模式则至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack in high mountain regions improve the predictability of subseasonal to seasonal precipitation patterns?

Interpretation.AnswerEn: Initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack helps in refining the model's initial conditions, which can improve the accuracy of predictions on subseasonal to seasonal timescales by better capturing the influence of surface anomalies on global atmospheric circulation patterns.

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in using ensemble simulations to capture the atmospheric response to Tibetan Plateau surface temperature anomalies, and how might these be addressed?

Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include large inter-model differences and discrepancies between simulations and observations. Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to inaccuracies in simulating Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures when using Earth System Models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在使用地球系统模型模拟青藏高原表面温度时，导致不准确的因素有哪些？

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation anomalies based on Tibetan Plateau temperature data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 基于青藏 Plateau 温度数据预测亚季节到季节降水异常的挑战原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges arise from the inability of current global land–atmosphere coupled models to accurately represent observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures, which affects the models' skill in predicting precipitation anomalies over remote regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于当前全球陆气耦合模型无法准确表示观察到的青藏高原表面温度，因此在预测远程地区降水异常方面，这些模型的能力受到影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific steps involved in initializing land surface temperature and snowpack conditions for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models in high mountain areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在高山地区，为亚季节到季节预测模型初始化地表温度和雪盖条件的具体步骤包括：

1. 收集高山地区的气象数据，包括温度、降水、风速等。
2. 获取遥感数据，特别是关于地表温度和雪盖的卫星观测数据。
3. 进行数据预处理，包括数据清洗、插值和缺失值填补。
4. 使用地表模型或雪模型，结合气象和遥感数据，模拟当前的地表温度和雪盖状况。
5. 校准模型参数，以确保模拟结果与观测数据一致。
6. 进行初始条件的设置，将模拟得到的地表温度和雪盖信息输入到预测模型中。
7. 进行敏感性分析，评估不同初始条件对预测结果的影响。
8. 运行预测模型，生成亚季节到季节的气候预测结果。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To initialize land surface temperature and snowpack conditions, two pairs of experiments with state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are conducted. The first experiment evaluates whether the ESMs can produce the observed temperature and precipitation anomalies. The second experiment adjusts the initial conditions of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over the Tibetan Plateau to reduce bias. This innovative approach ensures that the model starts with the correct thermal state, allowing for better prediction of downstream effects.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了初始化陆地表面温度和雪盖条件，进行了两组使用先进地球系统模型（ESMs）的实验。第一个实验评估ESMs是否能够产生观察到的温度和降水异常。第二个实验调整了青藏高原的陆地表面温度和地下温度的初始条件，以减少偏差。这种创新的方法确保模型以正确的热状态开始，从而更好地预测下游影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural challenges are faced when using ensemble models to simulate atmospheric circulation responses to land surface temperature anomalies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在使用集成模型模拟陆面温度异常对大气环流响应时，面临哪些程序性挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges include large inter-model differences in simulating the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere. There are often phase differences between the simulated wave trains and observations, which can lead to discrepancies, such as the ensemble mean producing warm biases or incorrect sign of precipitation anomalies in certain regions. These issues are attributed to deficiencies in model parameterizations and initial condition imbalances from reanalysis data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括在模拟从青藏 Plateau 到南半球的传播路径时，模型之间存在较大的差异。模拟的波列与观测之间常常存在相位差，这可能导致一些不一致，例如，集合均值在某些区域产生温暖偏差或降水异常的错误符号。这些问题归因于模型参数化的缺陷和来自再分析数据的初始条件不平衡。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the integration of land surface temperature and snowpack data from various sources to improve subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论能够整合来自不同来源的地表温度和雪盖数据，以改善亚季节到季节的气候预测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the field, methodologies involve using observed T2m records, such as those from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS), to examine relationships between Tibetan Plateau land surface temperatures and global precipitation. Numerical experiments with Earth System Models (ESMs) are conducted to explore the impact of initialized land temperatures on prediction skills.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在该领域，方法论涉及使用观测到的T2m记录，例如来自中国气象局（CMA）和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的数据，以研究青藏高原地表温度与全球降水之间的关系。通过地球系统模型（ESMs）进行数值实验，以探讨初始化的土地温度对预测技能的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges must be addressed to enable accurate data collection and initialization of land temperature datasets for climate modeling?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 为了使气候模型能够准确收集和初始化土地温度数据集，必须解决哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges include ensuring robust land initialization and model configuration due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data. Additionally, accurately preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in models is critical, as discrepancies can lead to underestimations of temperature effects and misrepresentation of precipitation anomalies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 挑战包括由于模型参数化和再分析数据的不足，确保稳健的土地初始化和模型配置。此外，准确保持模型中初始化的地表温度异常的记忆至关重要，因为差异可能导致对温度影响的低估和降水异常的错误表征。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be significant differences between observed and simulated temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau when using state-of-the-art Earth System Models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用最先进的地球系统模型时，观察到的和模拟的青藏高原温度异常之间可能存在显著差异的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The differences may arise from the models' inability to fully capture the initial conditions or biases in land surface temperature and subsurface temperature initialization, as well as potential deficiencies in model parameterizations and atmospheric/land reanalysis data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 这些差异可能源于模型无法完全捕捉初始条件或地表温度和地下温度初始化中的偏差，以及模型参数化和大气/陆地再分析数据的潜在缺陷。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might current datasets fail to accurately represent the influence of Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies on global atmospheric circulations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前数据集可能无法准确反映青藏高原表面异常对全球大气环流的影响的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current datasets might fail due to large inter-model differences in simulating propagation pathways and wave train effects, as well as biases in surface temperature measurements that affect the global scale atmospheric response representation in models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的数据集可能会因为模型之间在传播路径和波列效应模拟上的巨大差异，以及影响全球尺度大气响应表现的地表温度测量偏差而失败。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using the initial land surface temperature and snowpack conditions as a data collection method for improving subseasonal to seasonal prediction models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对使用初始地表温度和雪盖条件作为数据收集方法来改善亚季节到季节预测模型的有效性进行评估。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of initial land surface temperature and snowpack conditions is seen as a promising method for enhancing subseasonal to seasonal prediction models, as it addresses observed deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data, allowing for better predictions of June precipitation anomalies over global hotspots.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 初始地表温度和雪盖条件的使用被视为增强季节内到季节预测模型的一种有前景的方法，因为它解决了模型参数化和再分析数据中的观察缺陷，从而能够更好地预测全球热点地区的6月降水异常。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the methods used to initialize land surface temperature and snowpack data for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对用于初始化子季节到季节预测模型的地表温度和雪盖数据的方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the first phase of the LS4P project, initialization of the land surface temperature and snowpack over the Tibetan Plateau involves adjusting the initial conditions to reduce model bias, such as the TP T2m bias, by using observed anomalies to enhance prediction skill.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段，针对青藏高原的地表温度和雪盖的初始化涉及调整初始条件，以减少模型偏差，例如TP T2m偏差，通过使用观测异常来增强预测技能。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from different sources like NASA MERRA2 and GLDAS2 are integrated in regional models for climate simulations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何将来自不同来源的数据，如NASA MERRA2和GLDAS2，集成到区域模型中进行气候模拟。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The initial and boundary meteorological conditions for regional models are driven by data from sources like NASA MERRA2 for meteorological elements and NASA GLDAS2 for soil attributes, and these are integrated to simulate regional climate phenomena over the Tibetan Plateau.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 区域模型的初始和边界气象条件由NASA MERRA2提供的气象元素数据和NASA GLDAS2提供的土壤属性数据驱动，并将这些数据整合以模拟青藏高原的区域气候现象。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore methodologies for initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature in climate models to enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在气候模型中初始化地表温度和地下温度的方法，以提高亚季节到季节的预测准确性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The LS4P project involves initializing land surface and subsurface temperatures (LST/SUBT) in climate models to reduce biases in temperature anomalies, particularly over the Tibetan Plateau. This is done by adjusting initial conditions based on model biases and observed anomalies, aiming to improve prediction accuracy over subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: LS4P项目涉及在气候模型中初始化陆地表面和地下温度（LST/SUBT），以减少温度异常的偏差，特别是在青藏高原地区。这是通过根据模型偏差和观测异常调整初始条件来实现的，旨在提高亚季节到季节时间尺度上的预测准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify challenges related to model parameterizations and reanalysis data that affect land-atmosphere interaction studies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别与模型参数化和再分析数据相关的挑战，这些挑战影响陆地-大气相互作用研究。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in land-atmosphere interaction studies include deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial conditions provided by reanalysis data. These issues can prevent models from fully preserving memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, affecting prediction accuracy and the representation of land-atmosphere feedbacks.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 土地-大气相互作用研究中的挑战包括模型参数化的不足和再分析数据提供的不平衡初始条件。这些问题可能导致模型无法充分保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，从而影响预测准确性和土地-大气反馈的表现。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct an analysis of the potential impact of high-mountain land temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns using observational data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请对高山地区温度异常对全球降水模式的潜在影响进行分析，使用观测数据。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: High-mountain land temperature anomalies, such as those from the Tibetan Plateau, can significantly impact global precipitation patterns by modulating wave trains like the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train. Observational data indicate that these anomalies can influence precipitation predictability at subseasonal-to-seasonal scales, highlighting their potential as a substantial source of predictability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 高山地区的温度异常，例如来自青藏 Plateau 的异常，能够显著影响全球降水模式，通过调节波列如青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列。观测数据表明，这些异常可以影响亚季节到季节尺度的降水可预测性，突显了它们作为重要可预测性来源的潜力。
